intro: Ruschia sandbergensis, commonly known as the sandberg's ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It produces clusters of yellow flowers during the summer months. Ruschia sandbergensis is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
